fields.description:
Hi Nick,
It seems all languages still have "System Dashboard" in English, although there is one instance translated on the Transifex Back End project (details below).
I've checked a few languages and they are all behaving in the same manner. Note on screenshot 2 there is one localised instance of System Dashboard on the left side bar, so the string in Transifex might be that one instead. Searches in Front End came up empty.

Please see screenshots of EN, BR and FR attached.

Key
admin.menu.globalsettings.default.dashboard
Resource
jira_cloud_i18n.properties
String Hash
ad955f8de34767315b2bdc8bf4542640

Thanks
Luisa

fields.description:
The global sidebar icons, tooltips and panes are unlocalised on the main dashboard. They are correctly localised when accessed from other sections.

Repro steps – across all languages

1.	On https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview , hover over the global sidebar icons (search, create, help, user profile) to see tooltip
2.	Click on each icon
Result: All tooltips and panes are unlocalised
3.	On the Bitbucket sidebar, click on Repositories or any of the UI Options (Projects, Pull-requests etc)
4.	On the Repositories page, hover over and click on each icon on global sidebar
Result: All panes are localised
fields.summary: Global Sidebar unlocalised on Bitbucket Dashboard

fields.description:
When we are using Russian language and saving a workflow after editing, it shows ???? ????? ??????.
Affected JIRA 7.2.2, 7.7, 7.8, 7.9
Steps to Reproduce:
    Install a fresh JIRA instance using version 7.7
    Change the default or profile language to Russian
    G + G > Workflow > Select an active workflow and click Edit
    Publish the workflow and a notification will be shown as below
fields.summary: Russian translated text is corrupted in UI

fields.description:
from Oliver.Gramberg1@swisscom.com

 Dear Sir or Lady,
I am referring to https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/translate?lang=de_DE#/48/17544/Alle Gruppen/ALL/bearbeitete%20Version%20dieser%20Seite%20wurde%20als%20Entwurf%20gespeichert, where I see

A version of this page you were editing at {0} was saved as a draft.

Eine am {0} bearbeitete Version dieser Seite wurde als Entwurf gespeichert.

I searched for this translation after I experienced the following (on Confluence 6.2.4):

Eine am 8 minutes ago bearbeitete Version dieser Seite wurde als Entwurf gespeichert.

I find that "* {0}  minutes ago"* has been translated to "vor {0} Minuten" in 2017, so I assume that in newer version of Confluence the message reads,

Eine am vor 8 Minuten bearbeitete Version dieser Seite wurde als Entwurf gespeichert.

That's all German now, but still incorrect, as it should read, "Eine vor 8 Minuten…". Likewise, is it really correct to say "at 8 minutes ago" in English?

If there is never a date being provided as a parameter, and always a timespan, I suggest to change both the English and German texts to not include "at" and "am", respectively.

Regards
Oliver Gramberg
fields.summary: Better German translation suggested for "A version of this page you were editing at {0} was saved as a draft" string

fields.description:
To reproduce this issue, try to create a Service Desk project, change the language to Italian and go to ⚙ > Issues > Statuses.

Notice that the newly created statuses are not translated:

These statuses are actually not translated in any language.

https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/JSDS-2933
fields.summary: The statuses automatically created by Service Desk are not translated in any language (including Italian)

fields.description:
Description

When a Service Desk request is approved, the following sentence is added to the history of the request:
"Your request was ..... and the status changed to...."

This sentence does not seem to be translated in any language (I tested the German, French and Spanish languages so far).

Steps to Reproduce

    Create a Service Desk request that has an approval step
    Approve the Service Desk request
    Open this request from the customer portal
    Change the language of the customer who is viewing the request from the portal in German, then French, then Spanish

Observed

One sentence is still in English, as shown in the 3 screenshots below:

https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/JSDS-2933
fields.summary: Sentence "Your request was ..... and the status changed to...." is not translated whenever a request is approved

fields.description:
Summary

SLA date is showing in English
Steps to reproduce

    Change user profile to Russsian
    Browse any Service Desk issue that has SLA and notice the "-12w" instead of "-12н".

Expected Results.

JIRA should translate the week and month to

days - дни - д
weeks - недели - н
month - месяц - м

you see, for hours - часы - ч - all is fine.
fields.summary: SLA date is not translated properly to Russian language

fields.description:
cf. GHS-135084

Hello 
the file footer.vm does not uses international translations keys and is hence not translatable by inserting some keys.  Some companies / governments are legally bound to NOT use english in any of their tools, so this creates a legal issue. 
 The only way to bypass it is by modifying the file 
<installDir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/footer/footer.vm
 directly, which is not recommended.  Thanks for your understanding  Support Request Sent by: corentin.mehat@valiantys.com Priority: 3  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is the end of an automated request sent using the Support Tools Plugin ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------PriorityLevel 3Affects Version/s7.11.2Customer TimezoneGMT-5Partner ManagerJan KaanPartner Type/TierSolution Partner/SOLUTION_PARTNER_PLATINUM



----
Hi Corentin,Thanks for contacting the Atlassian Support Team and I'm sorry to hear that you're facing issues with Jira!Just to make sure that we're on the same page, could you please confirm which language pack you noticed this problem and if possible attach a screenshot here?Also, I'd like to clarify that most of the language packs were maintained by our community at the Atlassian Translations but this platform was retired and will be replaced by a new service soon.In the meantime, I'd like to recommend you to raise a ticket directly on the translation support portal: Product Translation Bug.Don't hesitate to reach us if you need any further assistance or have any further questions.We look forward to hearing from you.Kind Regards,Deyves Senger | Atlassian Support Engineer
fields.summary: footer.vm not translatable

fields.description:
Requesting changing the order of these two sentences for better understanding in Korean. Please see screenshots attached:

1.
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.customertype
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.dropdown.customertype.internal
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.dropdown.customertype.external

English Source Text (Exact)
My team serves (dropdown) 

Existing Translated Text (Exact)
내 팀은 다음을 제공합니다.(dropdown) 

Corrected Translation
내 팀은 (dropdown)에게 서비스를 제공합니다.

Issue Description
This sentence is hard to understand. Should change the location of the dropdown menu to make more sense. 

2.
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.usesit.start
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.dropdown.usesit.use
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.usesit.end
onboarding.template.wizard.survey.dropdown.usesit.dontuse

English Source Text (Exact)
We (dropdown)  IT service management workflows to handle requests.

Existing Translated Text (Exact)
우리는(dropdown) IT 서비스 관리 업무흐름을 통한 요청 처리

Corrected Translation
우리는 IT 서비스 관리 업무흐름을 (dropdown) 요청을 처리합니다.

Issue Description
Mistranslation. At least change the order of the sentence to make it more understandable. I suggest segment onboarding.template.wizard.survey.usesit.end to be'우리는 IT 서비스 관리 업무 흐름을' and key onboarding.template.wizard.survey.usesit.start to be '요청을 처리합니다.'
fields.summary: Placeholder issue - change order on concatenated string (Jira Cloud Back End)

fields.description:
Sub items on the "Linked Issues" drop-down are not localized. We had initially thought this was due to the environment being initially created in English.
Further testing was carried out on 2 Jira Cloud trial instances (Spanish and Brazilian Portuguese) that confirm these strings are in English, even if Chrome is set to each language while the trial environment is created. 

These strings were not located in Jira Cloud BE and FE projects or on the global search tool.
Note we have received a customer feedback for Jira Server on ticket LF-470 that confirmed this is also the case for Jira Server. 

Please see screenshots attached for the ES and PT-BR trial instance of Jira Cloud, and for the PT-BR Server instance of Jira.

All languages affected.

fields.description:
JSD Help Center > Requests > Created by me

It's translated as "Skapad av mig" which is common singular.
"Skapade av mig" would be more correct; as it's plural.

Related to this, above the issue table on the Requests page, "Requests" is translated as "Ärenden" which is different to the translation used in the top-right button "Begäranden", which should be the preferred translation.
fields.summary: JSD Help Center translation of "Created by me" is wrong for Swedish

fields.description:
When text is selected on a page, tooltips for "page.view.selection.action-panel" is missing for French :
page.view.selection.action-panel.create-inline-comment = Add inline comment
page.view.selection.action-panel.create-Jira-issue-summary = Create Jira issue

So for French :
page.view.selection.action-panel.create-inline-comment = Ajouter un commentaire
page.view.selection.action-panel.create-Jira-issue-summary = Créer une demande Jira

To litteraly translate "Add inline comment" it could be "Ajouter un commentaire intégré"
fields.summary: Confluence translation for "page.view.selection.action-panel" is missing for French

fields.description:
There's a description "Specify the default level of access to this project for logged-in users. Override this for specific user and group access below." in "Default permission" of "Project settings".

The second sentence "Override this for..." is in imperative form, but is translated as it's in declarative form.
The wrong translation sounds like "This overrides specific user and group access below" . So it is opposite meaning.
fields.summary: A description in project permission setting in Bitbucket Server is incorrect for Japanese

fields.description:
Hi,

The czech language pack should start a week on Monday but it's on Sunday. I found a workaround in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43385 but it doesn't work for version 6+ of Confluence because on that line are two numbers, not just one. 

Can you please check it and let me know what can I do? Or update it for a new releases?

Best regards

Vladislav Kolář

The Built-in Macros 'Column' and 'Section' were translated to German till Confluence-Version 6.9.1.

German translations: 
Section => Bereich
Column => Spalte

Please also watch the supportcase: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/14/CSP-255103
in which i was questioned to open this request.

Thanks a log

fields.description:
We had this comment from one of the linguists:

"In this case, "service desk" is "central de atendimento"? I'm asking because the explanation of the term says that when in uppercase is DNT and when in lowercase is "central de atendimento". However, in general glossary (right of the main translation screen), it is dnt in both lowercase and uppercase. Now I'm confused about it."

We use the generic term "service desk" in various parts of Jira and Jira Service Desk. When it is not capitalised, service desk should be translated according to the glossary. We need to ensure that the Smartling glossary is correct in this regard.
fields.summary: "service desk" (lower case) is in the Smartling glossary as a DNT

fields.description:
